posts.post_content:
Dream turn 1 combo: [Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamp),[Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) X 2,[Hymn to Tourach](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hymn to Tourach) x 2, Dream Salvage.  
  
EDIT: @Jax: "Only enough for one Dream Salvage, don't forget you need one mana to cast 2nd Dark Ritual."  
  
That's why I didn't follow "Dream Salvage" with "x2" like I did for Hymn and DR. I know, I know. By playing only ONE dream salvage in my combo, you're drawing a measly FOUR cards! Pish Tosh! ;-)
posts.html:
Dream turn 1 combo: Swamp,Dark Ritual X 2,Hymn to Tourach x 2, Dream Salvage.

EDIT: @Jax: "Only enough for one Dream Salvage, don't forget you need one mana to cast 2nd Dark Ritual."

That's why I didn't follow "Dream Salvage" with "x2" like I did for Hymn and DR. I know, I know. By playing only ONE dream salvage in my combo, you're drawing a measly FOUR cards! Pish Tosh! ;-)

Posted By: Paleopaladin (7/11/2010 11:25:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is an example of the kind of superb card design that makes Magic the Gathering an absolute BLAST to play.  
  
It's not particularly impressive on its own (in fact, it'll do nothing most of the time), but it quickly gains synergy with cards that force multiple discards, like Mind Rot, Stupor, and Hymn to Tourach, which already range from strong to devastating on their own. But that hardly even scratches the surface!  
  
Suddenly [Delirium Skeins](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delirium Skeins) and [Last Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Last Rites) seem amazing, and [Wistful Thinking](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wistful Thinking) - usually just a strange variant on [Mind Rot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Rot) - turns into [Mindculling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindculling)+ (target opponent net-loses two cards, you net-gain two cards, compared to [Mindculling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindculling)'s two and one, respectively) for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Blue or Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=UB&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) instead of ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)!  
  
Then there are cards like [Wheel of Fortune](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wheel of Fortune), [Flux](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flux), [Windfall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Windfall), and [Wheel and Deal/](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wheel and Deal/)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This card is an example of the kind of superb card design that makes Magic the Gathering an absolute BLAST to play.

It's not particularly impressive on its own (in fact, it'll do nothing most of the time), but it quickly gains synergy with cards that force multiple discards, like Mind Rot, Stupor, and Hymn to Tourach, which already range from strong to devastating on their own. But that hardly even scratches the surface!

Suddenly Delirium Skeins and Last Rites seem amazing, and Wistful Thinking - usually just a strange variant on Mind Rot - turns into Mindculling+ (target opponent net-loses two cards, you net-gain two cards, compared to Mindculling's two and one, respectively) for instead of !

Then there are cards like Wheel of Fortune, Flux, Windfall, and Wheel and Deal/... (see all)

Posted By: Ragamander (2/23/2012 7:14:39 AM)

posts.post_content:
@Kragash: Windfall is banned in Legacy because it enables certain unfair combos that involve drawing many cards. Look around for the Spanish Inquisition deck - it plays [Slithermuse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slithermuse) as a Draw 7 effect and can win a quarter of its games on turn one.  
  
This card's potential to draw many cards makes me think it might be possible to break in Legacy. It would be interesting against a [Breakthrough](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Breakthrough) dredge deck. "You drew 4? I draw 8!"
posts.html:
@Kragash: Windfall is banned in Legacy because it enables certain unfair combos that involve drawing many cards. Look around for the Spanish Inquisition deck - it plays Slithermuse as a Draw 7 effect and can win a quarter of its games on turn one.

This card's potential to draw many cards makes me think it might be possible to break in Legacy. It would be interesting against a Breakthrough dredge deck. "You drew 4? I draw 8!"

posts.post_content:
@Kragash: Windfall is banned in Legacy because it enables certain unfair combos that involve drawing many cards. Look around for the Spanish Inquisition deck - it plays [Slithermuse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slithermuse) as a Draw 7 effect and can win a quarter of its games on turn one.  
  
This card's potential to draw many cards makes me think it might be possible to break in Legacy. It would be interesting against a [Breakthrough](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Breakthrough) dredge deck. "You drew 4? I draw 8!"
posts.html:
